page.title: 08DALWOOD READING ROOM
page.content: The Reading Room in Dalwood was built originally to hold books for which there was no room in the school, as a library. A plaque outside the Reading Room reads 'This Institute was founded by Miss Susan Wakley on land given by Miss M. Brown'. It is said that the room was built to keep men out of the pub.The room is now regularly used by eleven men as a snooker room, with darts, table tennis and cards. Women are allowed to join but no women come. There are no books there now. The Reading Room was built in 1903. It is solidly built of stone with a high beamed roof. One school governor, Mr Harry Lawrence has been going to the Reading Room for twenty seven years since he was a boy. The room is now only used on Wednesdays.
